msgSnippet: Hi Colin, ... If you use inner classes, you will have problems using the JUnit Swing application.  I haven t tested this behavious but I doubt that it works

Subject: Re: [junit] Using JUnit with inner classes?

From: Vladimir Bossicard <vladimir@...>

Hi Colin,

> Of course, I'd rather switch over to JUnit, for many reasons, but have
> found so far that this idea doesn't cross over very well.

If you use inner classes, you will have problems using the JUnit Swing
application.  I haven't tested this behavious but I doubt that it works
fine (from my understanding of JUnit).

I don't know how many tests you have already written but I would
strongly consider moving the an all JUnit solution in the near future,
maybe with a transition period where some tests are still in an inner
class.

Doesn't help much but it's my opinion :-)

-Vladimir
subject: Re: [junit] Using JUnit with inner classes?
